title: American_Top_40_1985_June_29th
description:
THIS FILE WAS PREVIOUSLY TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_June_29th,_1985" IF YOU DOWNLOADED THAT FILE YOU ALREADY HAVE THIS ONE. THIS IS THE NEW TORRENT OF THAT SAME FILE AND THAT TORRENT WILL NO LONGER BE SEEDED. THIS IS ONE OF THE FIRST 15 I EVER TORRENTED. I'M JUST CHANGING THE NAME SO ALL SHOW TITLES ARE FORMATTED ALIKE.


"Billboard ranks 'em, American Top 40 counts 'em down."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

One song in this countdown is by an act that holds the all-time record for hitting the top 40 with the most lead singers.

Casey tells the story of the song that holds the all-time record for most weeks at number one. It was written by a convict serving time for attempted murder.

Air Supply is back in the countdown (now as a duo) for the first time since 1983 with their song "Just As I Am" (at number 2).

There is a band in the countdown that holds the all-time record for hitting the top 40 with the most lead singers. Casey explains.
